item.title: Red Hot Chili Peppers singer Anthony Kiedis hospitalized
item.description: Red Hot Chili Peppers singer Anthony Kiedis has been hospitalized, according to members of his band.
item.ExtractedText: 1 of 8 8 photos: 2016 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony Inductee Steve Miller performs. "Miller perfected a psychedelic blues sound that drew on the deepest sources of American roots music and simultaneously articulated a compelling vision of what music -- and, indeed, society -- could be in the years to come," the Rock Hall of Fame said. Hide Caption 2 of 8 8 photos: 2016 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony Ice Cube speaks during N.W.A.'s induction. They're visionaries who broke down barriers in society to let the rest of the world in on the harsh confinement of street life in America's forgotten corners, like Compton. Hide Caption 8 photos: 2016 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony Kimbra performs a tribute to the late David Bowie. Hide Caption 4 of 8 8 photos: 2016 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony Inductee Robert Lamm of Chicago performs. With jazz horns, the Chicago Transit Authority blasted wide-eyed, breezy reality right into it, and in its lyrics took vivid sun-drenched strolls like in "Saturday in the Park." Hide Caption 5 of 8 8 photos: 2016 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony Inductees Walter Parazaider and Lee Loughnane of Chicago perform. An act has to be in business for at least 25 years after the release of its first album to be nominated. Hide Caption 6 of 8 8 photos: 2016 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony Grace Potter and Sheryl Crow perform a tribute to Glenn Frey, the co-founder of the Eagles who died earlier this year. Hide Caption
